name: GSK rides to rescue as UK eyes neighbors nervously
introduction: British drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline has agreed to provide fill and finish services for Novavaxâ coronavirus vaccine, supplying 60 million doses for domestic use.
content:
British drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline (LSE: GSK) has agreed to provide fill and finish services for Novavax’ (Nasdaq: NVAX) coronavirus vaccine, supplying 60 million doses for domestic use.

In the fight against COVID-19, fellow UK-based pharma major AstraZeneca (LSE: AZN) has made most of the headlines thus far, with a successful vaccine rollout accompanied by a degree of political turmoil.

Vaccine nationalism

While UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson trumpeted the “strength of UK manufacturing” evident in the deal, the political furore surrounding AstraZeneca’s vaccine seems to have motivated the move towards bringing manufacturing within the UK.

European officials, under pressure to secure reliable supplies for EU-27 nations, have previously threatened to block exports of vaccines from the continent.

After talks with Novavax and the UK government Vaccines Taskforce, GSK agreed to provide fill and finish services at its Barnard Castle-based facility, with a rapid technology transfer between the two companies beginning immediately. 

GSK’s own vaccine program has been beset with delays, although the firm has more recently made significant progress with VIR-7831, a Vir Biotechnology-partnered (Nasdaq: VIR) antibody treatment. 

The firm said its agreement with Novavax would not impact on timelines for its coronavirus development projects.

Novavax agreement

The UK government has secured doses of NVX-CoV2373 from the US biotech under an advance purchase agreement.

The protein antigen component of NVX-CoV2373 is also produced in England by Novavax’ manufacturing partner, FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies.

NVX-CoV2373 has been shown to be safe and effective in Phase III clinical trials, and a regulatory decision is expected imminently. If approved, GSK could begin delivering finished product as early as June.

GSK vaccines president Roger Connor said: “GSK is delighted to support Novavax and the UK Vaccines Taskforce with this manufacturing arrangement for the UK.”

He added: “We have ensured that we can deliver these volumes without impacting supply of our other vital medicines and vaccines, and without disruption to the other COVID-19 collaborations GSK is engaged in globally.”

Novavax has also agreed to supply over a billion doses of its vaccine to low- and middle-income countries through the COVAX initiative.
